headline: Is Tesla facing a brand crisis when Elon Musk 'is the brand'?
summary: Earlier this week, Wedbush managing director and senior equity analyst Dan Ives warned that Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk "needs to change course" and reassess his commitments to the EV maker over his position as the head of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) in the Trump administration. Ives sits down with the Market Domination team to react to speak more about Tesla's branding, commenting on Musk's own proximity to President Trump. After President Trump's endorsement of Tesla on the White House lawn last week, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick urged viewers to purchase Tesla stock in a recent interview with Fox News. Also catch Dan Ives explain why Elon Musk is taking a "huge step forward" in rebalancing his responsibilities at Tesla, demonstrated in his all-hands meeting on Thursday where he implored Tesla employees to "hang onto" and hold off on selling their stock. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

Ives sits down with the Market Domination team to react to speak more about Tesla's branding, commenting on Musk's own proximity to President Trump. After President Trump's endorsement of Tesla on the White House lawn last week, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick urged viewers to purchase Tesla stock in a recent interview with Fox News. Also catch Dan Ives explain why Elon Musk is taking a "huge step forward" in rebalancing his responsibilities at Tesla, demonstrated in his all-hands meeting on Thursday where he implored Tesla employees to "hang onto" and hold off on selling their stock. headline: To Whoever Keyed The Car, Thank You!'—Cybertruck Owner Says Keying His Truck Backfired, Vows To Help Tesla Sell More Cars
summary: A Tesla Cybertruck owner returned from a trip to find his vehicle had been keyed. Instead of getting angry, he used the incident to promote Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA), saying the act of vandalism did nothing to hurt the company or its CEO, Elon Musk. ‘This Craziness Has To Stop’ Chris, who goes by “Common Sense American” on social media, posted about the incident, questioning the logic behind keying his truck. “Does this hurt Elon Musk?
